base_cluster_info.cluster_description: This generic cluster provides an interface to the current condition of a resource. A resource is a component of a device that is designed to be replaced, refilled, or emptied when exhausted or full. Examples of resources include filters, cartridges, and water tanks. While batteries fit this definition they are not intended to be used with this cluster. Use the power source cluster for batteries instead.
notes: This cluster is not meant to be used for monitoring of the system resources, such as processing, memory utilization, networking properties, etc.
This cluster SHALL be used via an alias to a specific resource type (see Cluster IDs).

features.summary: Supports monitoring the condition of the resource in percentage
Supports specifying the list of replacement products

data_types.name: DegradationDirectionEnum
data_types.description: Indicates the direction in which the condition of the resource changes over time.

values.name: Up
values.summary: The degradation of the resource is indicated by an upwards moving/increasing value

values.name: Down
values.summary: The degradation of the resource is indicated by a downwards moving/decreasing value

values.name: OK
values.summary: Resource is in good condition, no intervention required

values.name: Warning
values.summary: Resource will be exhausted soon, intervention will shortly be required

values.name: Critical
values.summary: Resource is exhausted, immediate intervention is required

data_types.name: ProductIdentifierTypeEnum
data_types.description: Indicate the type of identifier used to describe the product. Devices SHOULD use globally-recognized IDs over OEM specific ones.

data_types.name: ReplacementProductStruct
data_types.description: Indicates the product identifier that can be used as a replacement for the resource.

attributes.name: Condition
attributes.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the current condition of the resource in percent.

attributes.name: DegradationDirection
attributes.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the direction of change for the condition of the resource over time, which helps to determine whether a higher or lower condition value is considered optimal.

attributes.name: ChangeIndication
attributes.description: This attribute SHALL be populated with a value from ChangeIndicationEnum that is indicative of the current requirement to change the resource.

attributes.name: InPlaceIndicator
attributes.description: This attribute SHALL indicate whether a resource is currently installed. A value of true SHALL indicate that a resource is installed. A value of false SHALL indicate that a resource is not installed.

attributes.name: LastChangedTime
attributes.description: This attribute MAY indicates the time at which the resource has been changed, if supported by the server. The attribute SHALL be null if it was never set or is unknown.

attributes.name: ReplacementProductList
attributes.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the list of supported products that may be used as replacements for the current resource. Each item in this list represents a unique ReplacementProductStruct.

commands.name: ResetCondition
commands.description: Upon receipt, the device SHALL reset the Condition and ChangeIndicator attributes, indicating full resource availability and readiness for use, as initially configured. Invocation of this command MAY cause the LastChangedTime to be updated automatically based on the clock of the server, if the server supports setting the attribute.
